page.title: 01INTRODUCTION (P1)
page.content: The Cheesden valley lies across a triangle of towns.They are {Bury,Rochdale and Edenfield.}To the north of the triangle there is peat moorland,which consists of millstone grit.This is all sand and shells that littered the seashore.The valley was submerged,probably for ten million years,about two-hundred and seventy million years ago in the Carboniferous Age. The upper course of the valley falls seven hundred feet in two and a half miles.Lower down beyond Buckhurst Village it turns east.Cheesden Gorge was created by a deep glacial overflow channel of water of the River Irwell,at the end of the Second Ice Age,which covered Ramsbottom and Stubbins.
